name: Troy Ezell
text: Great to have a local card shop. Love it.

name: john bates
text: Great place to get any card, friendly staff and great selection.

name: Ben Hartman
text: Was passing through and decided to stop and was not disappointed a lot of modern boxes and vintage cards owner was very friendly overall if you are thinking of stopping by I definitely would

name: Matt Waters
text: I didn't catch the owners name, but I could listen to him tell stories for days. He knows the business as well as anyone, and strives to give each customer, no matter the age, plenty of attention and tries to personally get to know each individual. I swung by on a Friday afternoon when the phone was ringing off the hook, and the gentleman could not have been more apologetic about taking the calls- I wasn't bothered a bit, as the selection of cards was very enjoyable to look through. I'm looking forward to returning soon.

name: Max Cribb
text: I really like this store.  Mike is very accommodating and has a fantastic selection of vintage sports cards, mostly baseball and football.  He sells the latest in  Hobby boxes, also.. He seems to always have whatever supplies I need, as well.  There's a limit on those, but that will ensure others can get what they need, too. Stop by and see for yourself

name: Brandon Oster
text: I have never encountered a more genuine shop owner than the gentleman I just had the honor of meeting.  He talked to me and another customer for an hour and it was all for the sake of us gaining knowledge.  When I went to purchase a product with a pretty hefty price tag for 1 encased card he advised strongly to think about the purchase, and effectively talked himself out of extra money as I settled for something cheaper.  If you are in the area and are a sports fan go stop by and I bet you leave believing there still are great people around.

name: Aidan Garner
text: This place is amazing. Every time I go I find something amazing. I got one of my friends some nice cards from there. Love the place❤❤❤

name: Dave Norris
text: Good shop, great owner and fair prices.

name: Hunter Hall
text: Called ahead of time to ask about cards, was told he might have the one I’m looking for in one of his boxes. Little did I know the boxes he meant were his two glass cases with a couple dozen cards in them. You couldn’t have looked while I was on the phone with you? I thought you meant boxes of cards. Could have saved me a trip. I showed up to the store and took a look around while waiting for the guy to stop blabbering to his friend in the corner about the baseball players they don’t like, the blabbering never stopped and I was only asked if I wanted help on my way out of the store

name: Derrick Samuels
text: Great place to buy sports trading cards . Will return again!!!

name: Patrick Evans
text: Mike is one of the last scholars left in this hobby.  He knows both old and new on all main sports in the hobby market.  His prices are cheaper than you'll find from anyone online at the big box warehouses that dominate card distribution in today's card market.  He stays busy, but is always available to help out someone getting back into collecting, and really great at helping the next generation interested in the hobby.

name: Chris Garman
text: A+ service in every aspect.  Mike has done a great job of building his inventory with great high quality vintage and new material.  We had a great time talking about the industry and his experiences in collecting! He was also very welcoming and kind to a couple that was looking to sell there stack of 80s and 90s!  A rational response was provided when many in the industry are arrogant and rude when approached to buy worthless material.  I hope the word spreads that this is a premiere shop in Alabama!

name: Scott Quinby
text: The owner Mike is a fantastic guy. Takes his time to explain his products. He has all the current merchandise and a lot of older products as well. Prices are very competitive, if not cheaper. Support your small business guys and go buy from Mike! I know you will be happy with your experience.

name: Collin Aynes
text: Amazing card shop with great prices and lots of different hobby boxes from all sports. They also have a great selection of card supplies at very reasonable prices. Owner is super nice and always willing to help. If you need a sports collectibles shop to go to then this is the best one in the area by far.

name: Charlie Child
text: Recently moved to Birmingham so I obviously had to find a Local Card Shop, and I’m really glad I came across Mike over at All Star Sports Cards Emporium. Mikes a super knowledgeable owner and his shop is legit. I’ve been in 3 days in a row, and plan to keep coming back!

name: Billie Bunn
text: Best card shop in town!

name: Jerry Colley
text: I have been collecting sports cards for over 30 years and this is probably the best sports cards store in Alabama, hands down. It is very clean and well organized. It is very easy to find what you are looking for and the owner carries cards from all 4 major sports - baseball, football, basketball, and hockey. Good selection of modern and vintage cards, graded cards too!

name: Dr. Von’s Life Investing
text: The shop just opened up but as a hockey fan I am excited about having a local hobby shop to get cards from.  Prices on supplies like top loaders, binders and becketts are very reasonable and if you want something ordered just ask!  The owner is very hospitable.  If you are in to baseball he has a lot of very nice cards for sale.

name: Ricky Buchanan
text: The owner is very knowledgeable and prices are reasonable on most cards, collectibles and supplies.

name: Codipher D
text:
Mike was very friendly and informative for my little brother who is just starting his collection.
Definitely a great place to stop by

name: Michael Shekels
text: Fantastic card shop with a great selection of cards. Panini, Topps, Upper Deck they have it all. Everything from early 2000's to modern day. They also have card supplies like penny sleeves and top loaders. I picked up a hobby box of 2019 Topps Gypsy Queen for a great price, couldn't be happier. I will definately be returning, the owner is very kind and knowledgable.

name: Wisdom_ Hunter90
text: Great to finally have a LCS even though I live 60 miles away. 5 star all the way

name: Tommy Abney
text: Mike, the owner, is a great guy. Kind and fair all the way around.

name: Rick Robinson
text: Mike is a 1st class guy. What a collection and always has the newest product in.

name: Seth Mitchell
text: My experience here was fantastic.  The owner was extremely knowledgeable not to mention kind and more helpful than you could ever expect.  10 out of 10.

name: Larry Mize
text: Amazing place! Very helpful and kind with his time. Go see Mike!

name: Eric Greene
text: Good to have a shop like this in Trussville.  My kids and I have collected for years.  Hospitable and knowledgeable place.

name: Chase Daniel
text: Very nice store! Very knowledgeable owner! Great selection of vintage and newer cards!

name: Brad Butler
text: This is the best place ever, I give all the way around thumbs up

name: Rothe Family
text: The owner is sooooo kind! very knowledgeable & great selection!

name: Michael Garner
text: Massive stock.

name: Christian Clark
text: best place ever and very nice.

name: Sherika Fletcher
text: They answer me with respect thank

name: Joe Dowdey
text: Great cards and fair prices

name: Jen H
text: Owner is so helpful!

name: Eric Echols
text: I was driving through Birmingham on my way home at 8:00 in the A.M.  They weren't supposed to be open until 10:00, however John the owner allowed me to stop and shop around.  Their prices are great for people who buy by the box, and the selection and inventory available is outstanding.  I may start driving the 80 miles, to buy my cards from them on a regular basis.

name: Flip Black
text: Just recently a couple of my friends took me to the new CJ's next to our school and got me interested in Magic: The Gathering. The workers Tim and Erv who work there constantly are great guys and are always willing to help you out on anything. They seem to know their inventory- every card, MTG or not- by heart. When I bought my first deck Tim went out of his way to help me amp it up by showing me the best cards that were in my price range. By hanging out at CJ's for just an afternoon you're almost guaranteed to make at least one new friend, be it shop workers or people who come in regularly. Overall, CJ's is a great place to get cards for low prices, and the community is just as amazing.

name: Christopher Broughton
text: Either this place has moved from this location or doesn't exist.  I stopped by on 1 May 2016.  It was an empty store.

name: Nick Babcock
text: Stopped by twice on vacation. Door was locked. Called for an appointment.  No answer.  Drove from perdido twice and wasted over an hour. Dont waste your time here. There is an excellent shop in Pensacola.

name: Chris Kerr
text: I got here before 6pm 2 days in a row. They were not open. The second time she took the sandwich board and locked the door as we were getting out of the car. There is no sign with a business name or anyway to see in. Are they super underground cool?. I made a real effort to buy comics and collectibles. They didn't want my money. Maybe the owner is independently wealthy and just loves cards and SEC gear. He's a philanthropist who serves his community, when he wants to.

name: Quinn Moseley
text: Wasn’t open when it said it was very inconsistent

name: Calin Trabue
text: This place wasn’t even open when the door said it would be.

name: Rachel Graham
text: Great shop for your SEC gear. This is not cheap tshirts, these are high quality gifts and apparel and the price reflects it.

name: J Alexander
text: Friendly owners and they have some good deals in the store. Not a huge inventory, but enough to keep you interested and making return visits. The store is definitely worth checking out if you're anywhere near the area. Make sure to ask for the in store specials.

name: Melissa Vaughn
text: Great selection of cards and memorabilia but they don't accept debit or checks. (ONLY CASH) So they lost a 32 dollar sale.

name: Jerry Lee Moonshiner
text: Super place to purchase sports cards and other items! Visit their store, you'll be glad you did! I buy coins and old paper money there. They've got some old tin toys too!

name: Zach Allen
text: Awesome store , great guy

name: David Grimmett
text:
I little pricey on their cards but I understand they have overhead. It’s hard for any card shop to compete with the eBay craze these days.
Overall good experience!
The people that run the place are knowledgeable and very friendly.

name: April Belue
text: They have a variety of sports memorabilia and some nice antiques, you should stop by and visit their friendly staff !

name: yaboy Flash
text: This is the place to go for cards.They make good deals and have all the stuff you need to build a collection from older cards to newer cards.

name: Beans
text: Got into coin collecting here.

name: Thomas Hughes
text: Great environment and variety! Tim is a stand-up guy and you will receive professional service and great deals!

name: Kent Archer
text: Tim has a bit of everything in his shop. He has several clocks, some advertising items, several old toys, a large selection of sports cards, and several comics. I'm sure inventory varies, but it is worth swinging by.

name: Michael Smith
text: Nice little shop. A+

name: White bars
text: Great atmosphere and really freindly

name: Fred Reynolds
text: Great store has a lot to look at

name: Jake Winfrey
text: Great owner! Great selection!
